quiz1.questionText: RAM stands for Random Access Memory
Java is an Object Oriented programming language
What the programming languages used for cpp files? (make sure to Capitalize)
quiz1.explanation: cpp is an acronym for C Plus PLus

quiz1.questionText: Which of these is the HTML tag for making text bold?
quiz1.explanation: <bold> is not an html tag, and the other tags have different purposes, so it must be <b>

quiz1.questionText: What does CPU stand for? (make sure the capitalize)
quiz1.explanation: CPU is an acronym for Central Processing Unit as it processes most data in the computer

quiz1.questionText: What Operating System is developed and maintained by Microsoft?
quiz1.explanation: Windows is owned by microsoft, while the others are owned by Apple, Linus Torvalds, and Google respectively

quiz1.questionText: 6. Which is not a Java data type?
quiz1.explanation:
Floats and doubles store decimal
values, but decimal itself is not a data type; String and int
are also both valid data types.

quiz1.questionText:
7. _______________ is credited with
being the very first computer programmer. (Full name,
please)
quiz1.explanation:
Mathematician & writer Ada Lovelace
(1815-1852) wrote the world's first algorithm to the
Analytical Machine. The very first computer programmer
was a woman!

quiz1.questionText:
8. Which OS is developed & used by
Apple Inc.?
quiz1.explanation:
macOS is Apple's operating system for
personal computers & workstations; iOS is a system for
mobile devices.

quiz1.questionText:
9. Which of the following are object-
oriented languages?
quiz1.explanation:
C is an imperative procedural
language; it does not use classes, inheritance,
polymorphism, or other features of OOP.

quiz1.questionText:
10. GIF stands for ________
Interchange Format. (Please capitalize)
quiz1.explanation:
GIF stands for Graphics Interchange
Format.

GUI stands for Graphical User
Interface.

quiz1.questionText:
12. A binary system uses powers of
_____.
quiz1.explanation:
As indicated by the prefix bi-, binary
systems use powers of 2.

quiz1.questionText:
13. Which of the following are
functions of an operating system?
quiz1.explanation:
Database management is the
responsibility of a DBMS, not an operating system.
Operating systems do handle I/O management, job
scheduling & memory management.

quiz1.questionText:
14. Which of the following is the
ascending order of data hierarchy?
quiz1.explanation:
Bits make up bytes, which make fields,
which compose records, which together create files,
which ultimately form databases.

SQL stands for Standard Query
Language

A virus is a typically destructive
PROGRAM that replicates itself by modifying other
computer programs & inserting its own code.

quiz1.questionText:
17. Which of the following operations
are performed on RAM?
quiz1.explanation:
Both read & write operations can be
performed on RAM.

quiz1.questionText:
18. Python requires the use of ;'s at
the end of lines of code.
quiz1.explanation:
Unlike a language like Java, Python
DOES NOT require the use of ;'s to end lines of code.

quiz1.questionText:
19. Hash maps/hash tables store key-
value pairs.
quiz1.explanation:
Data IS inserted into hash maps using
key-value pairs.

quiz2.questionText:
20. This is used to find the length of
a Java ArrayList.
quiz2.explanation:
The .size() method is used to
determine the length of Java ArrayLists; .length is used
for Arrays.

Do-while, white, and for loops are all
valid in Java; if STATEMENTS are not loops.

CSS stands for Cascading Style
Sheet.

quiz2.questionText:
3. HTML determines the content of
a webpage.
quiz2.explanation:
HTML DOES outline the content of a
webpage - CSS styles it, and JS adds functionality.

1024 bits is equal to 128 bytes.
(There are 8 bits in each byte)

quiz2.questionText:
5. Select the command line/terminal
command that allows you to navigate up one directory.
quiz2.explanation:
cd .. is the command used to
navigate up one directory. The others are valid commands
but have other uses.

quiz2.questionText:
6. Select all valid methods of tree
traversal.
quiz2.explanation:
Reorder is not a form of tree traversal;
the 3 others are all valid.

quiz2.questionText:
7. Which of these is referred to as
the 'brain' of the computer?
quiz2.explanation:
As the 'brain of the computer', the
CPU retreives & executes instructions.

quiz2.questionText:
8. The SQL COMBINE clause is used
to combine tables based on a shared column.
quiz2.explanation:
The JOIN clause is what's used to
combine tables based on a shared column.

Alan Turing is credited with designing
the machine that broke Enigma.

Speakers & monitors are output
devices, while keyboards & mice are input devices.

DOM stands for Document Object
Model.

quiz2.questionText:
12. This animal shares it's name with
a Python module used to create vector graphics.
quiz2.explanation:
Turtle is the name of the Python
module used as a drawingboard to create graphics.

quiz2.questionText: 13. Flexbox is a CSS layout model.
quiz2.explanation:
The Flexible Box Model (aka. Flexbox)
IS a CSS layout model.

quiz2.questionText:
14. How many iterations are there to
this Java for loop? : for(int i = 1; i < 20; i++){...}
quiz2.explanation:
If this loop went from i = 0 to i < 20 it
would have 20 iterations; it instead starts at 1, so there
are 19.

quiz2.questionText:
15. == can be used to compare the
content of Java Strings for equality.
quiz2.explanation:
Java Strings should NOT be
compared using ==, but by using .equals() intead.

quiz2.questionText:
16. Which of the following is correct
syntax for printing 'Hello World' in Java?
quiz2.explanation:
The correct syntax for this Java print
statement is: System.out.println('Hello World');

Java is NOT short for Javascript. The
two languages are completely different.

quiz2.questionText:
18. Check all valid Java variable
names.
quiz2.explanation:
Variable names cannot start with
numbers; therefore, all of the chocies are valid except for
1myName.

RDBS stands for Relational Database
Management System.
